Reviews.Title: “good choice and value”
Reviews.Author: mac_elina
Reviews.Content: The superior room is really spacious, I have seen normal room while walking in the corridors, and indeed they may be a little bit small. The style is modern but not trendy-too-much, for me I feel like in a small studio. the bed is comfortable. My room was not facing the street, and was really quiet. In the bathroom, bath + hair dryer. Tea and coffee. The wardrobe is convenient. Breakfast is well served, with a reasonable choice of sweet and salt food. The black point as really often in Western countries : Internet is not included (I think around 10-15 €/day, which is something I still can't understand. NEvertheless, a computer is available in the lobby for punctual need.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Jauer_DK
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel with good service. Rooms are clean and the breakfast taste good.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Croms84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Honeymoon travels through Europe. We found the location to be great (close to the underground train station) and there are a few restaurants nearby. We loved the authentic German Pub which was across the road and went here a few times. Its about a 1 minute walk. The room was very light and airy. No issue with space at all. Would stay here again in a heartbeat :)

Reviews.Title: “The location of this hotel is a must.....and the breakfast too!”
Reviews.Author: Karen079
Reviews.Content: I visited the Winter Gendarmenmarkt Hotel first week of December 2011. The hotel doesn’ t give you the impression of a 4 star hotel from the outside but rooms are quite big and most of all modern with new furniture. Our room looked over the internal courtyard and so there was no street noises at all but still it had steel shutters at the windows. Beds are big and comfortable and wardrobes have plenty of shelving to put your things neatly. The central heating is wonderful in that cold weather, the room was warm and comfortable at all times. The bathroom is new and perfectly clean but still didn’ t like a couple of things about it. First of all it was designed on german standards which doesn’ t necessarily suit everyone. The bath is considerably high to get into causing a problem to my mother who is in her seventies. The same happened with the toilet that is a hanging model and was put too high off the ground and considering that I am of normal height I still had to sit with only my tip toes touching the ground. Apart from this fresh towels were changed everday and the room was cleaned thoroughly too. The cleaning service is good but a bit slow. I’ve never been in a 4 star hotel which took so long to tidy the rooms. Once we returned to our rooms after 3 o’clock in the afternoon and the room was still undone. Obviously we tidied the room ourselves that day cause the maid came around about an hour later and it was not worth it to let her in and wait outside in the corridor! The breakfast is a must and the best thing of our stay. It’ s an extensive buffet which should suit all likings. There was a selection of meats as chicken wings or nuggets, meat balls, different types of sausages, another selection of eggs, salads, breads and cheese, pancakes, croissants, cakes and fruit. Hot beverages are served by the staff directly on your table but there are also juices available at the buffet tables. Be a bit patient because the staff knows very little english. Another must of the hotel is the location which is very good. The metro is just 2 to 3 minutes round the corner and it’ s a very good shopping area too. The fact that it was christmas time helped a lot because the area is full of people all the time and streeta are very nicely decorated. By the way, even the hotel is decorated in a very nice way and with a huge christmas tree in the courtyard too. There is also a very close Christmas market in the same street, just 5 minutes walk away. The metro stop close to the hotel is connected with quite a couple of lines and so it’s easy to do some sightseeing too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, friendly staff and trendy decor”
Reviews.Author: MikeNAnna
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. The breakfast buffet is good with lots of variety. The interior rooms face an indoor court which is nice as you can open the large window. Beds a super super comfortable!!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: andreabarros
Reviews.Content: good location, very clean and polite staff. free wifi only at the reception floor. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AshleyJ21
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic location. Hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Would recommend this hotel to people wanting somwhere central to stay in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Good central Berlin for independent traveler”
Reviews.Author: Nordic_traveller56
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend to enjoy Christmas markets in Berlin. This hotel was rewarded by the good location and we can nothing but confirm. 2 minutes from subway stations, nearby the one of the best Christmas markets in Berlin, the location is good. Everything worked out as it should, rooms are silent and breakfast (with additional charge) is excellent. The deco is very minimalistic and plain, and the hotel lobby is very small and with limited capacity in seats, bar offering etc, but all the bars, cafe's etc are just around the corners. At least our hobby is not to hang out in hotel lobby while on vacation. Can recommend for weekends and other type of short holidays. More than 3 nights might give a bit tight feeling because of the small size of room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value stay”
Reviews.Author: lunabetty
Reviews.Content: We found Berlin to be great value and this perfectly located hotel was no exception. Very clean, modern and spacious with excellent, no-fuss service. Handy to metro and walking distance to many sights and good upmarket shopping around Gendarmenmarkt. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: sjoerdsma
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my boss and it looked just fine, but the room they put him in was horrible. Travelling alone is no reason to put someone in the smallest room they could find.. The location is wonderful though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice price, clean rooms....”
Reviews.Author: Frank_and_Barbara
Reviews.Content: We picked the winters because of price and location, because our main reason was to spend time in the city. It is not a Hotel to spend time in the hotel, except sleep (but you need a room with backyard view because of noise. Room very good, clean, service nice and friendly, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Opera_Lover03
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed 6 nights here in summer. The location was great and the metroline was very close to the hotel. The room was clean and the furniture quite new and modern. Only things I can complain about was the refrigerator, which did not keep our drinks cool at all. Our room was on the second floor, so we could hear the traffic from the street through closed windows. But in the evenings we were usually so tired, that this noise from the traffic did not bother us much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoJackie
Reviews.Content: This was not a luxury hotel, by any means. However, it was very clean, has a great location when touring Berlin, and the breakfast was very good. It has the most amazing selection of teas I have ever seen - all leaf, no bags.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ivever
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located close to "gendarmenmarkt" en the U-bahn "stadsmitte", from here its a small walk to checkpoint charlie, unter der linden, the berliner dom,... And with the U-bahn you can easily go to Kurfurstendamm and so on. I recommend this hotel for its awesome location!!! The rooms are clean, modern and have everything what you need!!! The breakfast is very good!!! When I go back to Berlin, it will be in this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: annedeane
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 days and never once used the sbahn or u bahn as we were able to walk everywhere from the hotel. We then only needed to purchased the welcome card for the museums visits only for 3 days -

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Shovesf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, quiet and reasonably comfortable despite being very small. We wouldn't, however, recommend it. Compared to other hotels in the area it isn't very good value for money. The breakfast was expensive and disappointing. Internet was very highly priced and there was also no wireless connection available. Furthermore, the hotel reception was understaffed which meant that the staff weren't particularly helpful. When we arrived, they watched us struggle through the door with our luggage but didn't offer any help. Our room also had no separate bathroom, but instead toilet, sink and shower were lined up in a row. Despite being a twin room, one of the walls of the shower was clear glass, which could prove quite embarrassing. This is definitely a no-frills hotel and despite the good location, we have definitely stayed in better hotels nearby in the past. Keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: krisnurse
Reviews.Content: This is a modern looking hotel with a good value for the price. This hotel was in a great location, close to Checkpoint Charlie and a block from the metro and great restaurants. The hotel was fairly clean, the carpets were in desperate need of a good shampooing. The beds were very hard. The breakfast was not included in the price and cost 12 Euro/day and was NOT worth it! The breakfast selection was minimal and drip coffee was offered rather than cappuccino or espresso. The employees were very nice and helpful. The internet was NOT free!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: osty6
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Lastminute.com as a Secret Hotel. We had previously booked such rooms and been very pleasantly surprised. But this hotel is not 4* as advertised. We had one large room and one very small room. The shampoos and body lotions were half used by the previous guest and not replaced. That gives one a feeling that the hotel does not care! The hotel had a boxed-in kind of feeling. We just stayed one night . It is clean and very centrally located.We asked for a glass of hot chocolate but they could not provide it although they said yes at the time of checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevew918
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty new, modern hotel, at a great, well-situated and safe Berlin location. It is within a block of the subway system, and there are many shops and restaurants nearby. A supermarket, Kaiser, around the corner was very convenient. The front desk staff was very friendly and efficient. The room was good size and furniture well placed. I agree with previous reviewer that it is like IKEA furniture, but to me it is comfortable and very functional. The shower has an interesting set-up that a clear side of the shower is towards to room’s front door. I do not have any problems at all. The only issue maybe if family with teenager of opposite sex. Other than that, it is a non-issue. There is only one elevation and it is so slow. We end up walking the stairs most of the time. For internet connection, it is available at a cost from the computer in the lobby or wifi in the room. Overall, it is a nice, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: ingrate
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. New, clean rooms with nice bathrooms. Great location, helpful staff. Easily the best hotel for the money that I have found in Europe so far.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: dsykes
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and booked via the secret hotel offer with lastminute.com. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel - it's spotlessly clean, modern in an ikea kind of way, and the location is fantastic, 5mins to checkpoint Charlie, lovely 15mins to brandenberg gate etc, could not be better. We booked a standard room but I think were given a superior as we had a perfectly normal bathroom and the room was very large. Crisp fresh sheets on bed, pumping shower and no noise at all...we slept well throughout. This hotel is also on the same road as several lovely restaurants and bars and a delicious chocolate shop (worth a look). Very pleased with the hotel all round.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation, brilliant location, superb breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: FreewheelerLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a three night citybreak. We arrived quite early and the room was immediately available. The room and general hotel decor were excellent - minimalist, very modern styling. Lovely full-size bath and shower. Everything looks new - it has obviously been done up very recently. The hotel is easy walking distance of the main sights, Brandenberg Gate, Unter Den Linden. Potsdammerplatz etc. Close to the main shopping street, Friedrichstrasse. The breakfast seems quite pricey at 12 euros but well worth it. A full range of cooked and continental dishes, limitless tea and coffee and very efficient staff. There are plenty of good eating places nearby for an evening meal. Close to tubes and buses. A great choice for business and tourist visitors. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: ferret_buzz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central, round the corner from U.Stadmitte for U6 and U2 lines, The staff are helpfull and the key card system for the lift and room leaves you feeling very secure. My friend and i were travelling on a budget, and we got excellent value for money for a twin room for 4 nights. The room was basic but had all you need. There is one thing to mention: the bathroom is a little unconventional. There is a toilet with a locking door, but the shower and sink are openplan. They are at one end of the room which may cause some awkwardness for people more used to thedir own privacy. This said I would still stay again, but I believe that if you book an upgrade there are rooms that do not have this feature,

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: sloughrushhour
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, in the centre of the city. We were very happy with all aspects of the hotel, the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke good English. As with most German hotels breakfast was not included, and at 12 euros, was only worth it if you had a big appetite. There is a good supermarket very close to the hotel, which will sell you juice, coffee, fruit etc.

Reviews.Title: “Location couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Nesswotr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with a friend in February. We had only booked a cheap room and got in offer so wasn't expecting too much. It turned out we had a nice sized room with twin beds and an en-suite bathroom with bath/shower. We were on the 4th floor overlooking the main road, but we didn't find the traffic noise too much of a bother and at night there were outside shutters that came down to help muffle the sound. There was plenty to choose from at breakfast, with both continental and cooked English available. The main draw though was the location. The hotel is minutes away from the U-Bahn station and very easy to find when you arrive. We had bought a WelcomeCard for transport but ended up only using it for the airport transfers as we walked everywhere, the hotel was in between most of the main tourist attractions. There were plenty of places to eat & drink round and about the hotel (I highly recommend Amici, across the square at Gendarmenmarkt) as well as supermarkets etc for bits we wanted to take in. I would definitely stay here should I visit Berlin again and was recommend it to anyone travelling on a budget but still wanting some decent accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price and Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: wallabyandwhirlwind
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my partner and found it to be exactly what I was looking for: a clean, spacious and convenient base from which to explore the city. I booked the Superior Room for 50 pounds without breakfast. The hotel is a minutes walk from the Gendarmenmarkt and Stadmitte station. It was an easy walk from our hotel to the Brandenburg Gate, Potsdamer Platz and Museum Island in 10 minutes. There is a range of dining options around the hotel for every budget and taste. Service was not good and not bad but I didn't have any requests.

Reviews.Title: “great location, tricky bathtub”
Reviews.Author: vasilyok
Reviews.Content: central location, ubahn station very close. room was small but cheap, so ok for one night. our room had a bathtub kind of built in into the room with glass wall overlooking the front door. didn't feel comfortable taking shower and praying that housekeeping stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in the center”
Reviews.Author: Rosario_it
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Berlin at the Postdamer Platz railways station and we reached the hotel in 10-15 minutes walking and we were very satisfied of the location of the hotel. As we arrived early in the morning we left the luggage in the hotel and went to explore Berlin. In the price of the room the breakfast was not included and so we decided not to have breakfast in the hotel. We left the hotel very early in the morning and we were happy to discover that there is an undergroung station just near the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic and stylish”
Reviews.Author: deejay8567
Reviews.Content: The room was very stylish and minimalistic - I loved it. It was very clean and the layout was good. The mattress was slightly hard but most people would like this. The water pressure in the shower was fantastic although the shower was in the room itself - slightly unexpected but once I was used to it it was fine. The breakfast was not included in my room price but was worth paying for. The cost of the room was exceptional for the quality. Location was also fantastic - right in the heart of everything and walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie, Jewish Museum, Alexanderplatz and Postdamer Platz. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Modern - a bit like Ikea”
Reviews.Author: Ikasumi
Reviews.Content: We thought that this was an excellent hotel for the price. The location was excellent - walking distance from all the sights - and there were several Christmas Markets in the local area. The hotel itself was spotless and had an interesting 'modern' feel which worked for us but wont be to everyone's taste. Occasionally the furniture did look like it had been bought from Ikea. The room was of a good size and was again spotless. The shower was excellent - the sort where you have to pick yourself up off the floor - and not in the middle of the room as is the case in some rooms (not a problem for couples but certainly awkward for friends). Good windows shielded the room from the traffic and there was even an electronic shutter which made the room an dark oasis of quiet in the middlen of Berlin. The only possible negative was that there were two single duvets instead of a double. This was not necessarily a bad thing but did seem a little 'odd'. We got the hotel for £33 a night (look for the secret 'New Design' hotel in Gendarmenarkt on lastminute.com) which, when you consider what your might get in London for the same, was outstanding. The deal was room only but it's much better to eat in nearby cafes anyway. All in all a great central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SPLENDID LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: AESCH
Reviews.Content: >We stayed a week at this property and quite enjoyed it. PRO - location is ideal, very close to Gendarmenmarkt, one of the nicest spot of Berlin - room was quite large, nicely furnished, colourscheme, grey/black/red quite trendy - bathroom was modern, large, well equipped - room was extremely quiet, facing inner courtyard - staff was helpful, attentive, fast - breakfast buffet very nice and varied - public transportation nearby CON - system of access with card somehow awkward especially in elevator ... - no restaurant but offer plentiful in immediate neighbourhood WE WILL. DEFINITELY RETURN

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, close to everything, good service.”
Reviews.Author: aliakapoor
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, close to the metro, walking distance to the hot spots - check point charlie etc... close to the unter den linden for nice cafes and close to the shops - close to the supermarket if you want to get some groceries too... the rooms are small and the bathrooms are tiny, but it is very clean and comfortable and central so thats what you need in berlin. the staff were very helpful and there is internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend. Incredibly small room and incompetent front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: AFilter
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel during a 3 week tour around Europe. This hotel was by far our biggest disappointment. I realize I can't expect much at its price point (We paid about $60 one night, and $80 the other), but I would have gladly paid more to stay in a better place. The room was by far the smallest room I have ever seen. There were two twin beds that may as well have been on top of each other - and we specifically requested a queen when we booked months ahead of time. The shower was impossibly tiny and the room was so small it felt like you were using the restroom and showering practically in the middle of the room. It was very awkward, and I'm not shy. My dorm room wasn't this small. Upon arrival we asked the front desk where was an area nearby that we could go for dinner. He showed us a map and directed us to a place several underground stops away. On our second night we discovered that Gendarmarket right down the road had beautiful restaurants and a stunning atmosphere. It seems incredible that the staff would not have informed us of this. Further, on another night we asked where we could find a pub to watch the English Premier League - they did not know of any pubs nearby and directed us to a swanky bar, not a sports bar at all. This was very disheartening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad beds!!”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Berlin Mitte area. For some reason the beds didn't have really a good Bed Mattress and could have been a lot better for being a four-star hotel. Very clean and good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, Convenient, Clean”
Reviews.Author: guferman
Reviews.Content: My parter chose this hotel for its convenient location - two blocks away from Gendarmenmarkt, shopping possibilities and excellent U-bahn links. The spartan lobby does not reflect the roominess of the contemporary and very clean rooms. What I most appreciated was the down-to-earth atmosphere, bold colors and simple lines, without the kitch that some costlier hotels tend to offer to impress their guests; that cna be very boring after the thrid day... The offer for brakfast (first floor - with view) was very convincing. I recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “93F outside, in hotel right now, air conditioning does not work.”
Reviews.Author: Ec0nPr0f
Reviews.Content: I'm in my hotel room right now with my wife and 2 little kids, it's 93F outside, and the air conditioning in the room does not work. Well, the front desk says it "works," but it is barely putting out any cold air at all. I have been in the room 2 hours with the air conditioning "on," and it's still in the upper 80's F. This is ruining an otherwise nice stay at this hotel. ONE OF THE MAIN REASONS WE BOOKED THIS HOTEL WAS FOR THE AIR CONDITIONING. I am hot after an all-day bike tour in the sun, and I was looking forward to a cool room tonight. I am not happy.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good but beware of twin rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Distant_Cousin
Reviews.Content: Excellent service however didn't get twin room that was booked, had to wait til following day to be moved. Bizarre, and very small twin room that had it's shower cubicle and sink all in it - not in a private room with the toilet . This was quite impractical and unsuitable for 2 friends sharing - or maybe we're just very BRITISH! Lovely breakfasts, v modern and extremely clean though. Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveler21
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at this hotel last week. The hotel was extremely clean, close to the U-Bahn (underground), reception were welcoming & spoke good english, there is a small fridge in the room and there is a computer with printer in the lobby free for use. There is a generic power point in the bathroom which accepted our two-prong'd aussie devices. The internet in the room however was not free (I think it was about $6EURO/6hrs). Location to the local sites was A1+ but in regards to the proximity to food/supermarkets it was difficult until we got to know the area. Also we think the bed was lined in granite, it was so hard we didn't sleep well for days. Overall though it's safe to recommend this hotel, but we'd avoid it because of the hard bed if we went again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: R_Vosters
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, nice and modern rooms, superb breakfast buffet, and one of the best locations imaginable for exploring the city. Would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bull4550
Reviews.Content: Spend the weekend with a group of friends in berlin and stayed in the Gendarmenmarkt. Great location, friendly staff and nice rooms. Everthing perfect but.... the room wasn't as clean as it could be, but it was a minor detail...

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and comfortable in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sciencegeek101
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Winters Hotel Gendarmenmarkt. The staff allowed us to check in early as we arrived before the normal check in time as we had travelled on the night train. This was a huge relief! The room was small - but we didn't plan on spending much time there as we wanted to explore Berlin so it was fine. Everything was new and clean. They even left fresh towels in a bag on the door handle when we left the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door when we were out! The shower was great. It's sort of all in one room so if you're sharing with someone you're not very comfortable with - it might be a bit of a problem! The hotel is very well located with a U-bahn only a couple of minutes walk away (Stadtmitte) and Checkpoint Charlie a 5 minute walk. We paid about 5 euros for 6 hours of internet which wasn't too bad. It's a great base for exploring Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but...brace yourself for bruises - It's TINY!!”
Reviews.Author: a_little_precious
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with Berlin and the friendly German locals - local pub food was absolutely amazing! The good stuff: Great little hotel near the underground and within 5 minutes from Check Point Charlie. Modern fit out and friendly staff. One computer on the reception floor with pay per use internet. Rooms were cleaned well and daily. The rotten... The rooms were so small I literally bruised myself getting around. I could not turn around in the shower without hitting the taps and I am not a very big person! The bed was small and rounded with wooden edged which weren't covered by the flimsy foam mattresses so watch yourself. The pillows (oh...those lumpy things...) and the wardrobe is the size of the mini bar. Perfect for a quick night's rest as the rates were very cheap but if you like to stay in, order room service and enjoy a cudlle, forget it. Did I mention the separate doonas? To be fair, I did order the small economy rooms but I had expected bigger than my wardrobe back home!

Reviews.Title: “great location but....”
Reviews.Author: Essex7
Reviews.Content: The Good - Excellent location a few mins to the tube. Good cafes and shops locally. you can walk to some tourist sights eg Check Point Charlie. The hotel was very clean we had a superior room which was spacious. Great for Xmas markets. The not so good - We had to keep going to the reception to ask for things which felt like constant moaning. Problems were: broken lamp ( x2) fresh towels not provided, toilet roll ran out, lumpy pillows and tea coffee not replenished at all. This is not 4 star service. We did ask for a room or rooms which would sleep 4 and that 2 beds had to be single ( our children are one boy one girl!! 15 and 13) we ended up with a double and a sofa bed!! This created a problem which the hotel could /would not remedy. We paid over £570 for 3 nights(no breakfast for that price) which felt far too much for the poor service and basically a double room with sofa.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Neneb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Winters Gendarmenmarkt at the end of November. This hotel is perfectly placed to explore Berlin's amazing and interesting sites. You can walk everywhere! The hotel is very contemporary and minimilist. Exceptionally clean throughout and the breakfast is great. The rooms - well again very clean. I stayed in a twin which was small but hey, if you are visiting Berlin, you should only really be sleeping in the room! The furnishing was simple and minimalist; comfortable and provided all I needed. If travelling without someone I would recommend seeking a king bed room though as a bit more space would be good. All up - you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PedroLobo
Reviews.Content: Hotel offers great location, close to most of attractions and good cafes and restaurants. Room is very clean and confortable - not very big, specially the bathroom. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great cental location..”
Reviews.Author: timbo01
Reviews.Content: What a nice small hotel in the middle of the city and right besida a U bahn station. Tons of hot water , big shower and all spotlessly clean. We had a corner room which was quite spacious but lacked a dressing table with mirror. Beds comfy and the AC was great. Staff were all friendly except for a very gumpy night porter.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: davethewasp
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, comfortable bed, good shower, good breakfast (with some tables outside), great location, great value for money. An earlier reviewer said it was a bit like a Travelodge but it is better than that; lots of good design features and attention to detail. Downside - lack of air conditioning in a packed reception whilst waiting to check out; my room was quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth it”
Reviews.Author: VivaV
Reviews.Content: Work trip. I had to live in a hotel for 10 days in Berlin. I thought this would be difficult, but it turned out to be quite lovely. Because I was on my own in a city where I do not speak the local language, I decided to look for one in a nice area, surrounded by restaurants and shops, and the U-bahn, aka subway. This meant splurging a little (for me, at least). The location was perfect, and the hotel first rate. The rooms are smallish but super cozy, minimally decorated, and the bathroom is actually spacious for European standards (and as soon as you turn on the shower, hot water comes out -how do they do it?). My rate included breakfast (with a discount, on account of my long stay) every day, which took place in a really modern, well-designed room that overlooks "bustling Leipzigerstrasse". It really felt like arriving home every night. And the staff really helped me out: told me where to have my suitcase repaired -and how to say it in German; recommended restaurants to have dinner at walking distance, reminded me when shops would be closed during festivities, and so on. Also, the place is well-designed but not over the top (which might have put off some of my business associates).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value but room rather small”
Reviews.Author: crazybeavers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in May 2009. The best thing about this hotel is definitely the location right in the center of Berlin in walking distance to many of the sights. The hotel has only opened this year and is accordingly modern. The room we stayed in was spotless, and pretty, but rather small for a double room, though. But we were able to get a very good price and were quite happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for all historical points”
Reviews.Author: FVC
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Very close to Checkpoint Charlie, remaining remnants of the wall and an easy walk to Potsdamm Plaza and Brandenburg Gate. Personally we would not rate the hotel as a 4*, more like 3* and very similar to a Travelodge/Premier Inn. The bar is next to reception and not somewhere that you could relax in an evening. Plus we had an outside room and the road is very noisy. However, the staff were friendly and knowledgeable recommending an excellant local restaurant. In summary, clean, friendly and a place to put your head down after a hard days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: RosaUtrecht
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. The U bahn (subway) is 3 minutes walking around the corner. Its in the center of the former east part of the City with all the places of interest. The direct surroundings (no view at) of the hotel is the Gendarmenmarkt (a very nice square) with some outdoor cafe's and upscale places like the Hilton hotel en the Newton bar and the famous Friedrichstrasse around the corner. The rooms are nice, not big not small. A bath, flat screen TV, a minibar. Staff is young and friendly. Breakfast is good, especially for the price (12 euro pp). Why not a higher rate? Because I think the hotel has no atmosphere, the hallway looks like a prison, very cold. Sometimes modern looks cool, sometimes it looks cold. And the service. We booked a superior room and I specially send a email to the hotel. When we arrived they told us they were overbooked and had no superior room. They only had a standard room but we had to pay for the superior room and gave us free breakfast. It was not possible to pay the price for the standard. We had to pay the price for the superior with free breakfast. I have seen the superior room when we left and I don't think its worth the extra money! Its a little bigger, thats all. The hotel is fine for a short city trip, but not that nice to return. Berlin is great!
